This recipe takes the viral "Dubai Chocolate" flavours and reimagines them in a cookie format. The base is a a delicious double chocolate chip cookie adapted from [Preppy Kitchen](https://preppykitchen.com/double-chocolate-chip-cookies/#recipe), providing a soft and fudgy contrast to the unique textures of toasted kataifi and pistachio paste.

---

### Time 
<span class="text-warning">1 hour</span>

---

### Ingredients

#### The Cookie Base
* 115g Unsalted Butter (softened)
* 20g Brown Sugar
* 80g Granulated Sugar
* 25g Honey
* 1 Large Egg (room temp)
* 5g Vanilla Extract
* 120g All-Purpose Flour
* 33g Cocoa Powder
* 3g Baking Soda
* 3g Salt
* 50g Dark Chocolate Chips

#### The Filling
* Kataifi (I substituted with shredded phyllo pastry)
* A knob of butter (for toasting)
* Pistachio Paste

---

### Instructions

1. In a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, cream together <span class="text-primary-emphasis">butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar,</span> and <span class="text-primary-emphasis">honey</span> on <span class="text-primary-emphasis">medium speed</span> until light and fluffy <span class="text-warning">(3-5 minutes)</span>.
2. Add in <span class="text-primary-emphasis">egg</span> and <span class="text-primary-emphasis">vanilla</span> and beat until combined. Scrape down the sides of the bowl occasionally for even mixing.
3. In a separate bowl, combine the <span class="text-primary-emphasis">dry ingredients (flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt)</span>. 
4. Slowly add the dry mixture to the butter mixture until combined while mixing on <span class="text-primary-emphasis">low speed</span>.
5. Stir in the <span class="text-primary-emphasis">chocolate chips</span>. 
6. Preheat the oven to <span class="text-success">375°F / 190°C</span>. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
7. Scoop <span class="text-success">1½ tablespoon-sized</span> balls of dough on the cookie sheet, placing them about <span class="text-success">2 inches apart</span>.
8. Bake for <span class="text-warning">10 minutes</span> or until cookie edges are firm and the center appears dry. 
9. Let cool on the sheets for <span class="text-warning">5 minutes</span> before transferring to wire racks to continue cooling. 

#### The Filling & Assembly
1. To make the filling, sauté <span class="text-primary-emphasis">kataifi</span> in a pan with a little butter until golden brown and crispy. 
2. Mix the crispy kataifi with <span class="text-primary-emphasis">pistachio paste</span> until it forms a thick, spreadable consistency.
3. **Pro-tip:** To stuff the cookies, created a little divot with a small round spoon, and place place a teaspoon of the pistachio-kataifi mixture in the center.

4. Decorate the top with some melted chocolate and gold, and enjoy!
